title: What is the winner of The Apprentice 2018 doing now?
text:
Sian Gabbidon and Lord Sugar’s business partnership has gone swimmingly since she won The Apprentice (Picture: Victoria Jones/PA Wire)

As The Apprentice series 15 continues, one of its keenest followers is Lord Sugar’s business partner and former series star Sian Gabbidon, who was the winner in 2018.

The 26-year-old is a passionate ambassador for the hugely popular BBC series, hosting her own Apprentice podcast, called The Wake Up Call.

The show talks ‘all things business’ and has featured early guests including Camilla Ainsworth, who became The Apprentice’s youngest ever finalist in 2018.

Apart from her burgeoning taste for broadcasting, what is the businesswoman up to now? Let’s take a look…

I DID IT… & what an absolute rollercoaster it’s been, overwhelmed and still can’t believe it – I’m ready and excited to start the https://t.co/UzNq9yXrg6 journey with @Lord_Sugar thankyou for ALL of your support throughout ❤️❤️ pic.twitter.com/1wXzxZwa9v — Sian Gabbidon (@siangabbidon) December 16, 2018

Who is Sian Gabbidon?

Born in Leeds in 1992, Sian Gabbidon had already founded her business, Sian Marie, before her ultimately victorious bid to win The Apprentice.

Gabbidon named Coco Chanel as one of her heroes, citing the iconic French designer’s rags-to-riches achievements as an inspiration.

Despite failing to make the grade for Leeds United Women because of her reluctance to head the ball, she said her ambition was to ‘make a splash’ with Lord Sugar from the outset after being picked to appear on The Apprentice.

That ambition took Gabbidon all the way to the final last December, where she pipped fellow finalist Ainsworth to win the series and score a partnership with the famous boardroom billionaire.

At the end of last series I hired @siangabbidon as my new business partner on #TheApprentice. Less than a year on, she's launched her swimwear, apparel and partywear collections at @sianmariefash – see https://t.co/cfB5lvSCEr. The Apprentice works. pic.twitter.com/d2ijc4LIMh — Lord Sugar (@Lord_Sugar) October 2, 2019

What is the 2018 winner of The Apprentice doing now?

The partnership with Lord Sugar seems to have been a success so far, allowing Gabbidon to expand her business into partywear, apparel and swim pieces to ‘accentuate curves’ and ’empower’ fashion fans.

Fellow reality TV figures, including stars from The Only Way is Essex and Love Island, feature prominently on the company’s website, posing in some of the shimmering pieces from the collection.

When Gabbidon launched one of her fashion lines’ first ever modest swimsuit earlier this year, she called the response ‘amazing’, saying: ‘I can’t believe how poor the market is in providing stylish modest wear.’

Two months after its June launch, Lord Sugar told his following of more than five million people on Twitter that the swimsuit was ‘still selling well.’

Gabbidon strikes a pose with boyfriend Clint Gordon (Picture: Jeff Spicer/Getty Images for Universal)

Gabbidon’s boyfriend, Clint Gordon, is no stranger to high-end fashion himself, sharing a house with her in Leeds while working as a model and appearing on TV.

As well as showing an impressive work ethic that often sees her at work before sunrise, Gabbidon has taken time out to enjoy herself in her first year as winner of The Apprentice.

She has enjoyed holidays to idyllic locations including Ibiza and Miami, taken trips to see the latest films at the cinema and shared her business expertise at a range of industry events.

Speaking to her fanbase of more than 72,000 followers on Instagram, Gabbidon recently revealed she will be hosting this year’s National Reality TV Awards.

The Apprentice is next on BBC One at 9pm tonight.
